drug.name: ACR325
drug.description: ACR325 is developed for the treatment of Parkinsonâ€™s disease and psychoses, including bipolar disorder, for which disease existing therapies have only limited effect and considerable adverse side effects. ACR325 is a dopaminergic stabiliser, which has demonstrated promising results in disease models for motor functions and psychoses.
drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in affective disorders, bipolar disorders, and psychosis.
drug.mechanism-of-action: ACR325 is a dopaminergic stabiliser. The compound significantly increases the level of dopamine and noradrenalin in the forebrain and concurrently inhibits the over-activity of dopamine in other regions of the brain without unwanted inhibitory effect on motor activity.
